chapter.title: Virtual machine Image File Format
chapter.para: While the virtualisation working group does not want the software to enforce a single data format we do want to support as many hyper-visor technologies as possible.
It is easier to support one image than many different image formats. For this reason the virtualsiation working group has come up with a single recommended format.
The file format is a joint decision of the working group.

section.title: Virtual Machine Image File Format V1

itemizedlist.listitem: Raw disk images are used as these are supported by Qemu and Xen natively.
The file will be partitioned using standard x86 partitioning schema.
The raw image file will be compressed with gzip to speed transfer of the images.
The Virtual machine will not use LVM as this may interfere with LVM running on the hyper-visor should it be necessary to mount the VM.

section.title: Virtual Machine Image File Format V2
section.para: Since the original disk format assumed all disk space was included in a single image this caused issues for image producers wanting to produce images that would be used with a variety of number of cores, Since the image would have need to be different sizes for different number of cores.
To resolve the issue of image size being proportional to the number of cores intended to be used with any image the image file format has been changed.
